page.title: 06Tourism at Greve de Lecq
page.content: The people that we interviewed at Greve de Lecq thought the beach was sheltered and in a nice spot. All the tourists got there by car. None of the tourists we interviewed had been for a swim and it was mid June; it hasn't been a nice summer so that's probably why. There was a kiosk owner on a slipway and he hired out his deck chairs at 40p for a day and 30p for a half day. He worked from 9am to 6pm. He was also a part time farmer and was worried about the possible infestation of colorado beetles (a potato pest in Europe but not in Jersey) that could happen if beetles blown from France took a hold. A pound of potatoes are 9p at the moment and show that the potato season is well advanced. Prices are much higher earlier on at the end of May.
